DataElement.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Global Health Version 1.1 Global06 Extent Able To Carry Out Everyday Physical Activities Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation about the extent to which they have been able to carry out everyday physical activities such as walking, climbing stairs, carrying groceries, or moving a chair, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PROMIS Adult Global Health Domain To What Extent Are You Able To Carry Out Your Everyday Physical Activities Such As Walking Climbing Stairs Carrying Groceries Or Moving A Chair Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses overall health in general, including global ratings of the five primary PROMIS domains (physical function, fatigue, pain, emotional distress, social health) as well as perceptions of general health that cut across domains._A person's assessment of the extent to which they can carry out everyday physical activities._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses overall health in general, including global ratings of the five primary PROMIS domains (physical function, fatigue, pain, emotional distress, social health) as well as perceptions of general health that cut across domains.

Concepts.definition: A Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) domain that assesses overall health in general, including global ratings of the five primary PROMIS domains (physical function, fatigue, pain, emotional distress, social health) as well as perceptions of general health that cut across domains.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with the PROMIS items that describes a range of subjective scores for representing the extent to which an individual is able to do something from 1: Not at all, to 5: Completely.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in amount, extent, or degree; constituting a majority.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: PROMIS Item Banks (Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Link to PROMIS Assessment Center for additional information and scoring.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
